body:
TD only ships with 42 maps right now, so replacing 36 (86%!) of them in one release is going to be hugely disruptive for casual players who may not have installed extra maps.

I'll pull out a list of the least popular TD maps online, then we should only remove the 5-10 (max) worst ones now.  This can be repeated again over the next few releases as the stats evolve.

@pchote Okay, we'll just delete them over time. I can wait :)
This PR is more about intention, what we should have in the end.

Although I think we should add all of the ones I propose: they are really popular.

BTW what's with the broken CI build?

> Although I think we should add all of the ones I propose: they are really popular.

The map stats should show this too.  Lets wait and see what they show, then adapt the change set accordingly.

> BTW what's with the broken CI build?

A couple of the maps that you have added fail our automated quality tests.  Click on the "details" link to see the errors.
You shouldn't rename map filenames since these are also used for identification on the Resource Center. Also I am against memes in commit comments.

Online match counts for the shipped release-20161019 maps are:
```
1218 IN-IslandDuel.oramap
779 morbid-aimless-poseidon-2.oramap
601 deterring_democracy.oramap
474 hegemony_or_survival_8p.oramap

42 the-hot-box
32 _lostsouls.oramap
```
Another important point to consider is that we should keep a variety of maps, avoiding flooding the map roster with only symmetrical tournment-style maps (even if they are the most popular online).

Only three of the new maps show any online matches:
```
13 burning-hammer.oramap
29 twisted-peak.oramap
7 ground-zero.oramap
```

I assume that this is caused by something in this PR having changed the map hashes.  Can you please link to the resource center pages for each of your new maps?
I don't like how this PR basically removes half of the most played 20 maps from the release.

That's an overhaul all right.

As to removing popular maps remember this was done to RA as well simply because they were terrible maps and the fact that these were played a lot was a bad thing.

The one thing I've complained about a lot on TD the past few years is the map pool and I've made sure to hammer that point across to the TD community whenever I had the chance. It's awful, doesn't really invite to good team games, actually doesn't invite to games whatsoever and as mentioned in the OP hurts TD's image. For many years TD has had some of the best map makers in their community but has failed circulation the official map pool with their contributions.

I haven't been involved much in TD the past couple of years but these are very old observations and the fact that these are still relevant is a problem for TD. The TD map pool is just _so_ incredibly bad. It has been neglected release after release its literally starting to look like an antique collection. I'm certain the casual offline TD players would appreciate a serious flushing.

The TD map pool forum thread recently held off making an impact for the next release: http://www.sleipnirstuff.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=82&t=17430

Another observation if I may - as for the **80+** TD balance changes with the previous and the upcoming release, a lot of these has been play-tested on custom maps, not official maps, in order to balance the game properly. I think that needs some serious consideration. TD is being modified _with hindsight on custom maps_, the maps the active online community play and not the maps the mod advertises to the casual offline player base.

>The previous 2 release presented us with 37 balance changes for the TD mod and the current bleed is shipping 52 for the next release. Not saying these changes by themselves are bad but one could see how that might have isolated the competitive core and started putting some real distance between competitive and casual play. TD might need some time to settle before a new healthy rank pyramid grows back into the player base.
quote from: http://www.sleipnirstuff.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=82&p=299934#299934

This gap has been growing faster with each release and I don't see the gap closing by carefully add/removing official maps over the course of several releases. There's just no time and from my point of view, TD is running out of time making a future for itself.

IMO TD needs to take a risk and what better way to do it going hand-in-hand with the recent balance overhauls #12536 #11550 #11758. The potential benefits _far_ outweighs the risks and I'd wager a growing player base one year from now will thank you for it.

@SoScared makes a convincing point, so i'm willing to give hugely disruptive a chance.

I guess my only real concern is that these maps skew quite hard towards symmetric team maps.  I think it would be good if we can include some additional assymetrical/scenic/ffa maps to balance these out a bit.

There are a few of the removed maps that are somewhat "iconic" such as **Sea and Cake** (2p), **The Hourglass** (2p), **Break of Day** (4p) and **Tiberium Oasis** (4p). These are pretty choky and cozy maps that would ease the transition. If there are new, better alternatives out there the TD community could easily swap or add them later.

As for the big team maps, I think it's all good. Also interesting with the multiple player versions for some of the big team maps.
I agree with @SoScared's picks.  Are there any other good new maps that we can include for these? (from the two map contests?)

Yeah the 2017 TD contest maps so far don't look to promising. Here's the results from the map contest of 2016: http://www.sleipnirstuff.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=82&t=19525

Entry 9: Antartica
Entry 14: Hidden Valley (add tiberium trees)
Entry 33: Glowing Crater 

for me looks good on the eye

Edit: nvm, this PR already have maps added from that contest.

@pchote @SoScared 
I've brought **Sea and Cake** (2p), **The Hourglass** (2p), **Break of Day** (4p) and **Tiberium Oasis** (4p) back.

The commit message is still a meme, @SoScared's reasoning is valid for the additions, but doesn't justify the most popular map removals - if the maps are that bad, then the next release onwards, their popularity should dwindle on their own. This PR as-is is feels too forced and just encourages my belief that TD is becoming more of a selected few's own mod promoted to official status instead of being a neutral OpenRA game as it's supposed to be.

Besides, East vs West 3 is the most playable 3v3 map in the mod.

No map called as Golden Nuggets exists on the Resource Center. Neither Frontal Assault. I haven't looked up the rest but I have a feeling there are more of such which also sounds like a problem.

>TD is becoming more of a selected few's own mod promoted to official status instead of being a neutral OpenRA game as it's supposed to be.
 
i feel the same for RA , "some" people think its necessary to replace every map with a strict balanced version of it (or even a new map) where every spot and ore-patch should be mirrored ... additionally rules get approved by a group of people that play mostly 1v1's , giving the team-gameplay aspect almost no attention

@GraionDilach I'll gladly upload any official map that lacks in the resource center. I'm gonna have to go through the RA's official maps anyways as I suspect I might have deleted a map or two from the resource center.

Anyways, bad custom maps are played en masse across all the mods so I don't recognize the argument for this. These maps you mention are popular _only_ because they're in the official map pool. If they're weren't they'd be dead and gone aeons ago.

>Anyways, bad custom maps are played en masse across all the mods so I don't recognize the argument for this. These maps you mention are popular only because they're in the official map pool. If they're weren't they'd be dead and gone aeons ago.

Then I guess no harm is done if time proves your point by giving the old maps a chance to actually compete against the new ones and not being killed off under a Trump meme.
And have 100+ maps in the official map pool? I don't see that happening. Regardless I think the above rationale speaks for itself.

It lacks concrete proof however since there are no stats for 90% of the added maps. I don't buy that. Also 100+ maps shouldn't be a problem, popular mods like Twisted Insurrection or Mental Omega have map pools beyond 200 maps even.

This discussion is degrading into bad-spirited speculation from both sides, which is not at all helpful.  For the sake of having a productive discussion:

* I requested above links to these maps on the resource center so that we can look at stats as well as having a papertrail on where these came from.  This still stands.
* @GraionDilach: Are there any specific maps that you particularly object to removing ("all of them" is not going to be helpful).  If you have a good argument for keeping them then @dtluna has already said that he's happy to keep them.

Personally, I don't like the idea of having super-large (more than say 90 - 100) official map pools in any of our mods.  That just smells of poor curation.
EvW3 is the sole map I play TD on.

@pchote

Can we get a commit message that will be helpful when reviewing history?
No one is going to grep for a political reference.
@Phrohdoh I'll change it when we come up with a final map lineup.

This map has the fixed spawn locations. The link in the Map Pool is invalid because it got deleted from the center. http://resource.openra.net/maps/19523/

So this one can be updated over the official version.
